You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
source('games_modeling.R')
team_names <- teams$PREFIX_2

graphs = list()
i<-1
model.features <- c("o_rebounds","d_rebounds","assists","steals","blocks","turnovers","fouls","shots_perc","three_shots_perc","FT_perc",
                    "shots", "three_points_shots", "FT_shots", "points_std", "minutes_std", "Players_counter",
                    "o_rebounds_relative", "d_rebounds_relative", "assists_relative", "steals_relative", "blocks_relative", "turnovers_relative",
                    "fouls_relative", "shots_relative", "three_points_shots_relative", "FT_shots_relative",
                    "shots_perc_relative", "three_shots_perc_relative", "FT_perc_relative")
evaluation.measures.table <- data.frame(Team = character(),
                                       Season = character(),
                                       AUC = double(),
                                       Accuracy = double(),
                                       CVAccuracy = double(),
                                       baseline.improv = double(),
                                       stringsAsFactors=FALSE) 
for (team_name in team_names) {
  model_features_table = data.frame()
  most_influent_features= c()
  
  for (season in c('2011/2012','2012/2013','2013/2014','2014/2015','2015/2016')){
    win_perc <- getWinPercentage(games.stats, team_name, season)
    features_table <- getFeatureInfluence(games.stats = games.stats, team = team_name, season = season, model.features = model.features, features.subset.size = 5)
    features_table$season_cap <- c(paste0(season, "(", win_perc, "%)")) 
    
    model_features_table <- rbind(model_features_table, features_table)
    most_influent_features <- unique(c(most_influent_features,mostInfluentFeatures(model_features_table,5)))
    
    #now we'll measure the predition ability and will save it to the big table
    cur.measures <- getPredictionAbility(games.stats = games.stats, team = team_name, season = season, model.features = features_table$features)
    evaluation.measures.table <- rbind(evaluation.measures.table, data.frame(Team = team_name, Season = season, AUC = cur.measures$auc, Accuracy = cur.measures$accuracy, CVAccuracy = cur.measures$CV.accuracy, baseline.improv = cur.measures$CV.accuracy/max(win_perc/100, 1-(win_perc/100))-1))
    
  }
  
  most_features_table <- model_features_table %>% dplyr::filter(features %in% most_influent_features)
  
  g <- ggplot(data=most_features_table, aes(x=season_cap, y=variance.diff, fill=features)) +
    geom_bar(stat="identity", position=position_dodge(),  width=0.8)
  
  g <- g+theme(
          text = element_text(size=12),
          axis.title=element_text(size=14,face="bold")
          )+
        xlab("Season and win percentage") +
        ylab("Percentage of variance explained") +
        ggtitle(team_name)

  graphs[[i]] <- g #add graph to list
  i <- i + 1
}

multiplot(graphs, ncol=1)
most_features_table
evaluation.measures.table
```
